title: Tyson Fury drops MMA and Conor McGregor bombshell ahead of WWE debut
text:
Tyson Fury says Conor McGregor will train him as he moves into MMA (Picture: Getty)

Boxing superstar Tyson Fury has claimed he will train with former UFC champion Conor McGregor ahead of a move into mixed martial arts.

The undefeated heavyweight boxer, 31, will make his WWE debut against Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia on Thursday.

But Fury, who fought Deontay Wilder in a heavyweight classic last year, says he has discussed a move into MMA and been in contact with McGregor.

Fury will make his WWE debut against Braun Strowman (Picture: Getty)

‘Who knows? I have got something big coming up after this, even bigger than this,’ Fury told Sky Sports. ‘We might see Tyson Fury have his MMA debut this year.

‘Tyson Fury is taking over. I have been speaking to Conor about it. He’s willing to train me. It’s gonna be good.

‘He’s just said any time that you are ready come over to Dublin and let’s go. I can’t wait, I’m going to take him up on the offer.

‘Who knows we might be on a double-header. I come from a long line of bare-knuckle boxing champions.

‘Getting hurt, getting bloodied is nothing new to me, it’s all a part of my heritage. I would love to get in there and smash someone up.’

As Fury continues to explore opportunities outside of boxing, Wilder has claimed the Brit will pull out of next year’s scheduled rematch.

McGregor himself will return to UFC next year (Picture: Getty)

But Fury has hit back at the claims, telling Boxing Social: ‘It’s not me.

‘Wilder’s got to fight Ortiz, so we’ll see how that fight goes and then make a decision on whether it’s going to be in February or not.

‘If he loses, it’s definitely not going to be in February is it? It’s not going to happen at all. He’s going to have a rematch with Ortiz.’
